clinical_study.brief_title: High-resolution Computed Tomography (HRCT) Evaluation of Airway Distensibility in Lung Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: High Resolution Computed Tomographic Evaluation of Airway Distensibility in Lung Transplant Recipients: A Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

brief_summary.textblock: Lung and heart-lung recipients at the University of Texas Medical Branch who have participated in the "Assessment of Cough Reflex in Lung Transplant Recipients" study who meet the specific study inclusion/exclusion criteria will have one study visit where they will undergo lung volume measurements, followed by high resolution CT scan of the lungs within 2 hours. After the initial CT scan, patients will be given a standard dose of Atrovent, followed thirty minutes later by repeat lung volume measurements and CT scan.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two hours (before and after inhalation of ipratropium)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in spirometry following inhalation of nebulized ipratropium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two hours (before and after inhalation of ipratropium)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in total lung capacity, functional reserve capacity and inspiratory capacity following inhalation of nebulized ipratropium

other_outcome.time_frame: Two hours (before and after inhalation of ipratropium)
other_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in airway caliber as determined by high resolution chest CT images following inhalation of nebulized ipratropium

arm_group.description: All eligible patients will undergo the same procedures

study_pop.textblock: All patients who participated in the "Assessment of Cough Reflex in Lung Transplant Recipients" study who meet the specific inclusion/exclusion criteria for this study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- lung transplant recipients >18 years of age
- at least 12 months or greater from time of transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- hemodynamic instability
- hypoxemia
- pneumonia
- moderate or large pleural effusion
- clinical evidence of acute rejection
